channel.title: Player killing at spawn - read or be punished
channel.description:
It has come to my attention that when the admins are offline, PvP at the spawn city has become popular. This is a formal warning to everyone that PvP at the main spawn city (within the walls) is strictly prohibited. Lumbridge is to help new players get started, as well as support the current players if they are in need of assistance.
Any PvP inside the walls will result in at least a one day ban.

item.title: Player killing at spawn - read or be punished
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:40, topic:381432”]Time to unban me guys.[/quote]I believe I did unban you. However, I don’t know how IPBans work, so unless you PM me your IP so I can manually unban it, it might not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Player killing at spawn - read or be punished
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:37, topic:381432”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=477243.msg3493043#msg3493043 date=1297058858]

I thought the idea was that it was a community town? That everyone would be welcome but nobody would permanently stay (or at least not build, just use the facilities)

I’m fairly sure the idea behind the city is for people to hang out and be neutral and help newer players start out (i.e. contribution chests)
[/quote]Yup. The question is, how do we handle it. Like do we force them to move out after a certain amount of time? And when they do, do we force them to make their own attackable faction? (or join another?)[/quote]
You can’t really “force” them out, you just don’t allow them to build their own house. So if they want to actually make their own place and play the game they have to be outside the safe zone.

Read full topic

item.title: Player killing at spawn - read or be punished
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

And I am on for at least 4 hours a day, I don’t know what you’re talking about :rolleyes:

And whoever suggested the VIP’s become mods - It’s probably not going to happen. The difference between VIP and Mod is similar to the difference between senior member and moderator on the forums: big.

But I do agree we need more staff. Strike (StrikeMC on the forums) has been made moderator. He’s been very helpful, trustworthy, and reports players to me often. He’s also over 12 years old :rolleyes: (by 9 years, in fact :P)

Read full topic
